greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Involution of nonnegative integers: Swap the positions of digits q0 <-> q1, q2 <-> q3, q4 <-> q5, etc. in the base-4 expansion of n (where n = ... + q4*256 + q3*64 + q2*16 + q1*4 + q0)
link: Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: 29 = 0*64 + 1*16 + 3*4 + 1, i.e. 131 in quaternary and when digits are swapped in pairs, results 1013 in quaternary (1*64 + 0*16 + 1*4 + 3 = 71 in decimal), thus a(29)=71.
program: (Scheme:) (define (A126006 n) (let loop ((n n) (s 0) (p 1)) (cond ((zero? n) s) (else (loop (floor->exact (/ n 16)) (+ s (* p (+ (* 4 (modulo n 4)) (modulo (floor->exact (/ n 4)) 4)))) (* p 16))))))
xref: Cf. A126007. A057300 is the analogous permutation based on swapping the binary digits of n.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 02 2007
